OBJECTIVES OF THE PROGRAMME
The Biomarkers Group (BMA) at IARC applies analytical technologies to measure the exposome in large epidemiological studies and human intervention studies to improve the understanding of the role of metabolic and environmental factors in cancer etiology.
More information about the Biomarkers Group (BMA) at IARC can be found at the below link:
https://www.iarc.fr/research-groups-nme-bma-rationale/
The purpose of this new position of Research Assistant (LC-MS, bioanalytical laboratory services) within the BMA Group is to support untargeted metabolomics studies by performing laboratory analyses and related activities on a liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry (LC-MS) based platform.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES
Under the direct supervision of the Scientist in BMA, the Research Assistant carries out the following key duties:
1) Sample analysis with the LC-MS instrumentation
The incumbent conducts sample analyses on the LC-MS platform in BMA. Based on requests by the supervisor, this includes independent coordination of shipments, storage, preparation and analysis of biological samples by LC-MS. In more detail, the tasks include communication with organizations/collaborators for shipment and reception of samples, coordinating the sample storage, planning analytical batches with proper sample randomization schemes, extracting samples and operation of the LC-MS instruments according to SOPs. All activities are documented in an electronic notebook, with details of sample handling in the dedicated lab information management system.
2) Operation and maintenance of the high-resolution mass spectrometry instruments (LC-MS)
The incumbent monitors and contributes to ensuring optimal performance of the instrument, by conducting periodic maintenance and system suitability tests according to SOPs, evaluating the test results, and reporting adverse findings to the supervisor. The incumbent communicates with the manufacturer for repairs/maintenance when requested by the supervisor and schedules as well as organizes the preventative maintenance visits of the instrument manufacturer.
3) Other related laboratory operations
The incumbent ensures that the laboratory is able to quickly respond to analysis requests, by keeping track of a stock of consumables and functioning of the supporting equipment. He/she is also expected to evaluate the need for consumable purchases and handle purchase orders.
4) Collect and analyse LC-MS data to build and maintain an in-house compound library
As requested by a supervisor, the incumbent purchases, prepares and analyses chemical standards for LC-MS information for storage in an in-house chemical library. He/she analyses the raw data and adds the information into the database, providing the supervisor and other lab members with database updates.
5) Participate in the development of analytical methods, software tools, and databases
The incumbent provides feedback and assistance for new analytical developments, including development of software tools for sample and analytical data management and for assessing data quality, based on supervisor’s request, and writes SOPs together with the supervisor.

Education
At minimum, graduation from secondary school with scientific orientation or equivalent, plus specialized training as a laboratory technician or research assistant recognized by a diploma (BTS, DUT or equivalent).
Experience
At least three years’ professional experience in bioanalytical laboratory testing and analysis preferably with LC-MS.

Essential:
Experience in working in analytical chemistry laboratory.
Experience in operating an LC-MS instrumentation by following SOPs.
Fluency and efficiency in use of MS Windows, basic programming skills including R and Shiny, and ability to quickly learn new software.
Ability to adapt to the requirements of laboratory quality and regular documentation of tasks.
Ability to work in a timely manner in a project-based environment as a member of a team that includes diverse cultural backgrounds.

Knowledge of French and other UN languages an asset.

The Institut Laue-Langevin (ILL) is an international centre for scientific research situated in Grenoble, France. It is Europe's leading neutron science facility. Research Scientist (F/M) - SANS in soft-matter/life science -

Duties:
The LSS group comprises a range of instruments designed to carry out studies on the structure of matter on a scale of fractions of to thousands of nanometers. The range of science is broad, covering polymer and colloid science, structural biology, materials science and magnetism. Small angle neutron scattering (SANS) is the most popular technique in the group with three highly demanded world-class instruments D11, D22 and D33. The instruments have similar performances with an emphasis on soft matter developments on D11, life science on D22 and magnetism on D33, although all areas can be reasonably covered by all instruments. Working within the LSS group in the field of soft matter or life science you will be in charge of:
providing support to users for scientific experiments in soft matter or life science on the three SANS instruments and offering guidance with experimental design and data analysis,
co-operating the small angle scattering instruments (D11 and/or D22), participating in their technical development and upgrades including sample environment and data analysis,
conducting an independent research programme in soft matter or life science and contributing to the scientific environment at the ILL.

The successful candidate will be formally assigned to either/or D11 and D22, which are both undergoing detector upgrades and are equipped with in-situ complementary techniques including DLS and SAXS in the case of D22. The running of the SAXS instrument may become one important duty.

The successful candidate must have a Ph.D. in physics, chemistry or biology, completed at least one period of successful postdoctoral or equivalent research and experience in neutron and x-ray scattering on soft matter or biological systems. Expertise in SAXS measurements, an interest in time-of-flight measurements and general interest in software development for data from soft matter or life science systems will be an asset.
